channel.title: Palestine on The Condition of the Republic
channel.description: Recent content in Palestine on The Condition of the Republic

item.title: Notes on Palestine, the Zionist Entity and the Arab regimes
item.description: Black, Ian. Enemies and Neighbours: Arabs and Jews in Palestine and Israel, 1917 - 2017. Penguin, 2018. Denvir, Daniel and Takriti, Abdel Razzaq. The Dig: Thawra Episodes 1 - 16. 2024. Introduction 12 The Ottomans officially surrendered to the Brits inside Jerusalem’s walled Old City on 9 December 1917. This ended four centuries of Ottoman imperial rule. Palestine owed its name to the Romans; to Muslims it was home to Jerusalem’s al-Aqsa mosque (the third most sacred site after Mecca and Medina) from where the Prophet Muhammed ascended to heaven.
